intro: Psychotria furcata, commonly known as the sacred plant of the Yucatec Maya, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small white flowers. The plant is notable for containing the alkaloid dimethyltryptamine (DMT), which has been used in traditional spiritual practices. Its botanical structure includes a woody stem with opposite leaves and a distinctive branching pattern at the base.
